summary: The Nintendo 64 (N64) is a video game console made by Nintendo. It came out in 1996 and was the last console to use cartridges before the Nintendo Switch. It competed with the Sony PlayStation and Sega Saturn. The N64 was known for its 3D games, like Super Mario 64. It had a powerful 64-bit CPU. Some games needed an extra accessory for more memory. The console was a big hit but sold less than the PlayStation. It was discontinued in 2002 after selling over 32 million units.
title: Nintendo 64
